text: hello this is chef john from food wishes
calm with moussaka burger or is it
moussaka burger moussaka is a greek
eggplant and lamb casserole that I love
more than almost anything I'm gonna make
it in burger form now most of the lamb
you get in the supermarket is from
Australia or New Zealand but this is
good old American lamb all natural by
the way the best thing about this
American lamb it came with amusing lamp
on stickers wish you were here and my
personal favorite bad to the bone
alright we're gonna keep that
refrigerated for now and besides lamb
the other main ingredient is eggplant so
we're gonna take one small eggplant and
peel it just go around with a sharp
knife I'm going to cut that in slices
cut that in sticks and then turn it and
dice it now you can really control the
texture of this burger with how much
eggplant you use I'm gonna give the
recommended amount is two cups I used
about twice that in here because I
wanted like a very soft moist burger I'm
also gonna have some diced yellow onion
of course all the amounts are gonna be
on food wishes alright in a saute pan
with a little bit of olive oil with a
big pinch of salt I'm gonna sweat those
onions on medium high heat for a few
minutes until they sort of turn
translucent at that point I'm gonna dump
in my eggplant and we're gonna cook this
on medium heat so turn the heat down a
little cook this on medium heat until
the eggplant just basically soften
they're gonna turn from white to this
like opaque color and they're gonna look
like that at that point we're gonna add
the rest of the seasonings which are dry
oregano black pepper cinnamon key
ingredient a little cumin and fresh
garlic all right we're gonna give that
about a one-minute saute just to take
the edge off the garlic I'm gonna put in
a couple teaspoons of tomato paste give
that a couple minutes and that is done
all right turn that off reserve it on a
plate and let it cool completely in fact
best if you even refrigerate that after
it cools you don't want to mix that in
the lamb when it's warm so traditionally
a moussaka is topped with a cheesy cream
sauce so we're gonna translate that to
our Burger by making like a little
cheese spread here so in a sauce pan I
have a tablespoon of olive oil with some
flour we're gonna make a little quick
roux there for a couple minutes alright
as soon as that smells sorta like
cooked pie crust we're gonna add cold
milk all right that's gonna thicken up
as it comes to a simmer whisk that in
we're gonna season that some freshly
ground nutmeg some black pepper some
cayenne and then turn off the heat and
pour in your Parmesan cheese the real
stuff
Ruggiano all right stir that set it
aside that will be our cheese spread so
that's very similar to what would go on
a moussaka casserole all right to
assemble we're gonna take our cold lamb
very important meat has to be cold when
you form burgers so cold lamb salt we're
gonna put in our cold eggplant mixture
mix that with our fingertips until just
combined
you can definitely change the amount of
eggplant if you want something that's
much firmer like a traditional hamburger
texture you can use much less eggplant
if you want something very soft almost
like a sloppy joe texture really really
tender you can add more eggplant and
then we're gonna form patties I'm gonna
make four once the burgers are formed we
could refrigerate those until needed and
then we're gonna make a little quick
tomato mint salad to garnish this with
tomatoes aren't great right now so we
got to do some tricks these are the best
I could find so we're gonna slice those
thin I'm gonna marinate those in a
little bit of rice vinegar which is
gonna bring out the sweetness in the
tomato also some fresh mint salt and
pepper so I'm simply gonna toss the
tomato slices with the mint and the
vinegar and the salt and pepper there
and we're gonna set that aside and now
for a final assembly I'm gonna salt and
pepper those very well on both sides and
all great burgers our pan-fried or done
on a flat top grill it's just the way it
is so I'm gonna cook those in just a
little bit of olive oil over a
medium-high heat for me one about four
or five minutes per side for medium to
assemble toast some delicious soft rolls
toasting is key don't serve burgers on
non toasted bread come on all right
we're gonna spread it with our cheese
sauce by the way feel free to use a lot
